revised_title: Observations on Saturn's Figure, Climate, and Atmosphere
tldr: In this article, William Herschel discusses his observations and findings on the figure, climate, and atmosphere of Saturn and its ring. He describes the planet's shape as flattened at the poles and slightly flattened at the equator, with the equatorial regions appearing more curved than the polar regions. He also examines the changes in Saturn's appearance due to its different aspects and the influence of its ring on its figure.
